english: (1) structural particle for verb complements; (2) to get, obtain; (3) must, have to

etymology.description: 貝(貝) (bèi, "cowry") + 又(又) (yòu, "hand") -> obtaining valuables -> 彳(彳) (chì, "step") added, 又 changed to 寸(寸) (cùn, "inch"), 貝 corrupted to 旦(旦) (dàn, "dawn") -> final form 得
etymology.interpretation: The character's evolution reflects the concept of obtaining valuables via picking up cowries, which were historically valuable. The addition of 彳(彳) (chì, "step") shows action, reinforcing the meaning of acquisition.
etymology.simplification: The process of simplification involved changing components to similar-looking elements, such as 寸(寸) (cùn, "inch") replacing 又(又) (yòu, "hand"), and 目(目) (mù, "eye") before becoming the simpler 旦(旦) (dàn, "dawn").

examples.chinese: 他跑得很快(他跑得很快)。
他得了一本好书(他得了一本好書)。
examples.pinyin: Tā dé le yī běn hǎo shū.

examples.chinese: 你得早点起床(你得早點起床)。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ děi zǎo diǎn qǐ chuáng.
